box.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: a container for putting things in, especially one with four stiff straight sides
box.translation[0].definitions[0].note.t: toolbox/shoebox/matchbox etc (=a box used for keeping tools etc in)
box.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: the amount of something contained in a box
box.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: a small square on a page for people to write information in
box.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: Put an ‘X’ in the box if you would like to join our mailing list.
box.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: a square or rectangle on a page where information is given or where an answer can be written
box.translation[0].definitions[3].exampl: The box on the left gives a short history of the battle.
box.translation[0].definitions[4].defini: a small area of a theatre or court that is separate from where other people are sitting
box.translation[0].definitions[5].defini: a small building or structure used for a particular purpose
box.translation[0].definitions[6].defini: a special area of a sports field that is marked by lines and used for a particular purpose
box.translation[0].definitions[7].defini: a piece of plastic that a man wears over his sex organs to protect them when he is playing a sport, especially cricket
box.translation[0].definitions[8].defini: a small tree that keeps its leaves in winter and is often planted around the edge of a garden or field
box.translation[0].note_box[0].sections[: We packed all our things into big cardboard boxes.
Plastic storage boxes are useful for  putting things in the attic.
The hammer’s in the tool box.
She used to keep photographs in old shoe boxes.
Most of the kids bring lunch boxes to school.
A jewellery box had gone missing.
How much have you got in your money box?
Thieves stole £100 from a cash box at the school.
There was a pile of boxes in the street outside the house.
box.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: to fight someone as a sport by hitting them with your closed hands inside big leather gloves
box.translation[1].definitions[1].exampl: Help me box up the Christmas tree lights.
box.translation[1].definitions[2].defini: to draw a box around something on a page
box.translation[2].definitions[0].defini: to think of ideas and solutions that are completely different and new, especially in business
box.translation[2].definitions[0].exampl: It’s always diffiult to think outside the box and come up with a good product name.
box.translation[2].definitions[1].defini: if something ticks all the boxes, you think it is very good and exactly what you want
box.translation[2].definitions[1].exampl: Sony’s new high definition TV ticks all the boxes.
